item.description:
Simple race game. Roll a die and move along the track. The track is a string of sausages. Obey the instructions should you land on a designated space. First to reach the dog's hide-out, wins.

The game features two characters from the Disney film Oliver & Company, Oliver and Dodger. It appears in the Disney and Me Annual 2000.

English (German follows below):

The city is a Card Game.

Everybody knows UNO: Just put cards of the same colour or the same number on top of each other to be the first without cards.

Now there is the Vienna-Variant: The colours symbolize metro-lines, the numbers bus-lines. Therefore each card stand for another station in Vienna and its transfers.

~*~

Die Stadt ist ein Kartenspiel

Jeder kennt MAU MAU oder UNO: Legt Karten gleicher Farbe oder gleicher Zahl aufeinander um als Erster alle Handkarten loszuwerden.

Jetzt gibt es die WIEN VARIANTE: Die Farben auf den Karten stehen für die Wiener U-Bahn-Linien und Zahlen für die Bus- und Bim-Linien. So bietet jede Karte - je nach Station - mehr oder weniger Umstiegsmöglichkeiten.

Free DTP war game.

The game "Niemenczyn 1794" recreates a skirmish, which occurred on 27th April 1794 near Vilnius. Polish unit of Lieutenant Colonel Stefan Grabowski attacked outnumbered force of Lieutenant Colonel Lewiz. The insurgents lost the clash. Board war game “Niemenczyn 1794” gives you the opportunity to lead Polish and Russian forces that fought against each other. An alternative scenario allows players to see how the battle could have turned out if more insurrectionary cavalry had taken part. Will the Poles enter the enemy camp? Or will the Polish attacks be stopped by Russian musket and artillery fire? The outcome of that battle is in your hands.

Rules of the game utilize the proven mechanisms of the games of the battles of the Kosciuszko Uprising ("Raclawice 1794", "Szczekociny 1794" and "Maciejowice 1794"). Due to the small amount of counters, "Niemenczyn 1794" is a good introduction to these games.

Defend the Village is a Cooperative Deck-Building game in which 1-5 heroes team up to save a village under distress from low-life bandits and hard-hitting villains! You take turns buying new weapons, potions and helpful items while also fighting off bandits before they destroy all six of your battlegrounds all the while praying you have enough strength to destroy all 5 villains! Do you and your fellow heroes have what it takes to defeat these villains and save this innocent village? Only time will tell…

Each player is dealt a random Hero with their own stats and ability. Each player also starts with the same starting hand. On each players turn they will reveal a card from the bandit deck and then spend the cards from their hand to purchase new items, or fight a Bandit or Villain.

Easy to learn, tough to survive.

Description from the designer:

Become CEO by tricking your coworkers!

Corporate Ladder is a card game of deal-making, bluffing, and office humor for 2-6 players. Negotiate with your co-workers on what performance review cards you each will play. Equal cards give you both a Promotion and move you up the corporate ladder, but be careful: a worse card will give you a Warning and push you towards an early retirement.

Think your rival is going to betray you? Sneakily call in a favor from your rolodex by playing a business card to gain an unfair advantage.

Dole out enough Warnings to get your competitors fired or earn enough Promotions to rise to CEO and win the game!

A point to point block game that allows gamers to refight the final phase of Grant's 1863 Vicksburg Campaign. 1 Player is Grant and his Army of the Tennessee. The other player commands the armies led by Pemberton and Johnston, which can be split allowing for a three player game.

Gamers can refight the entire campaign in 2 hours or under. Low unit counts, and short turns create great tension, decision making, and high player interaction.

Each game comes with a sturdy card stock map, blocks and labels, dice, short 8 page series rules, and game specific rules.

name.value: I've Brought You Back a Baby Dragon

item.description:
Board game in which people go off on a trip and have to bring back ice cream, postcards and purple dragons. You go round the board (with some choice as to where you go), nip into shops picking up souvenirs, and head home when you have a full set.

The other players are both racing against you and can occasionally swap what you have with someone else.

The board is a work of art, and the pieces are typical tourists with flowery hats and cameras.

The game comes with a dice for movement and to help you escape the task of browsing in a shop.

The board has symbols, so the game should be playable in any language with a set of rules in that language.

The rules are simple and complete. You can learn the game in about 2-3 minutes, and there are no surprises (e.g. odd exceptions) so the game flows well.

The game features a series of challenging trivia questions. Players alternate turns asking questions and earning Star Wars picture cards for correct answers. There is also a "steal" mechanic that allows opponents to steal each others' cards. The first player to earn four picture cards wins the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
The weather outside is frightful! After a day of outside play in the snow, its time to race home. You and your friends split up and head to your respective homes, trying to get there first. Snowballs thrown by your opponents and the blistering cold will slow you down, and if you're not careful, you might freeze before you arrive.

Snow Day has players creating Paths with cards, hoping to create a route from their origin point to their Home. Each turn, a player places a new Path card from a draw pile or manipulates an existing Path, then rolls a Movement Die to determine their movement, and finally accounts for their loss in body temperature. The game acts as a race against both your friends and the weather itself, as players lose temperature on each turn. If their temperature reaches zero, they're frozen solid and eliminated from the competition.

Players can disrupt one another's paths as a defensive move, at the potential cost of their own path development. Special Path cards also allow for a player to chuck an imaginary Snowball at an opponent, speeding up their friend's freezing process. The first player to arrive to their home before freezing is the winner.

BARBARIANS & EMPIRES - OCCIDENT ARENA, takes you and your fellow players to the ancient world at the beginning of the third century BC. In this edition you are fighting for the supremacy in the western Mediterranean and Western Europe, the geographical area which the Romans and Byzantines designated as Occident. In the western Mediterranean powers, the Greeks, the Carthagians and the Romans compete for hegemony; in the north are powerful nations such as the Celts, Germans, and Dacians, who, if they are not at war to each other, aspire to the warm, sweet and rich regions of the South. The Iberians fight for their own survival. It was the time shortly after the Celtic storm on Rome, done by Brennus and after the death of Alexander the Great. It was the period of the Punic wars, followed by the beginning of the Germanic invasions of the Cimbri and Teutones, which once again placed Rome at a great danger. They were defeated only by consul Marius after his military reforms. Now you play for the supremacy in the Occident in those last pre-Christian centuries, in which the gates of the Roman Temple of Janus were only closed once. Choose your people and win!

While playing, you have to successfully develop several skills to win, namely those of a military strategist, a prudent economist and a skilled diplomat. Increase your empire revenue through urban development, conquests and through your navy, which dominates the trade revenue in sea zones. Use your diplomats and support your army leaders or trade with other players, instigate revolts, gain neutral provinces peacefully, manipulate the opposing army commander, or send huge sums of money to support your allies. Secure your domains by garrison troops and fortifications. Build powerful armies, recruit the best of your people to increase the performance of your army, and develop strategies to force your powerful enemies to their knees. Hope, that Fortuna favors you. May the gods be with you!

Reach the supremacy of your nation in the Occident. You can achieve this dominance by leading the victory-chart at the end of 8 rounds or you can eliminate one of your adversaries in a Deathmatch by conquering his last province. Several winners in different order categories are possible. If a last province of an opponent has been conquered by your army, you place one of your markers on the skulls on the game board. No matter how the game evolves, you are one of the game winners, as long as you do not lose your last province, too. Any player remains in the game until he has completely lost his last province (does not apply to the nation of BRITANNIA, they stay always in the game!)

Swedish memory game for children. Literally "Pack daddy's suitcase".

Players take turns placing cards showing different items in the "suitcase", creating a new card deck. When all cards have been placed the first player then tries to remember in which order the items were placed in the deck ("suitcase"). For a correct guess items are kept by the player. If the player makes an incorrect guess, the turn is passed on to the next player.

Description from the publisher:

Sexy Ninja Death Squad (or SNDS for short) is a fast fire card game designed for 2+ players than can last from 15-25 minutes. Players furiously attack each other and defend themselves in order to be the last ninja standing. Each card can be used in attack or defence and placed in the Head, Body or Legs position depending on it's tabs. There is an Active Character Token (or A.C.T.) which signifies the active player. On receiving this you draw one card and can play one card on the players sitting next to you. They then have to block this attack with a card of their own OR give you a hit token (you have 3 of these in the standard game). When you lose a hit token you recharge your hand back up to 5 cards. Lose all 3 and you are defeated.

There are three special indicators which can appear on the cards and these signify 'Flurry', 'Riposte' or 'Ninja Star' cards. When a Flurry card is played in an attack you immediately draw another card and can play another attack card. If another Flurry card is played then you draw and play another attack and so on...

When a Riposte is played in a defence you immediately draw another card and can play an attack card on the player your attacker. If a Flurry card is played then its free second attack can hit any valid player.

The third type of card is the Ninja Star which can attack anyone.

Flurry and Riposte cards chain without limit which means your games get very hectic very quickly. The more people who are playing the more fun it becomes because more players means more ACTs!

It is not uncommon for other players to attempt to kill steal by lobbing a ninja star across the table, or you having to change tactics when your carefully prepared Flurry chain gets blocked and you have Riposte attacks to survive. Sometimes it is better to take the damage, lose a hit token, recharge your hand and come out swinging.

Teams of 2 or more compete to reach the end of the track on the game board. Each turn, one team member rolls a die to determine which of the 4 categories they will attempt.

Oodle Doodles is simple drawing; 
Model Madness involves modelling with clay provided in the box; 
Paper Mash-Ups has the player folding and tearing paper; 
Scribble Riddles requires drawing a phrase, saying or something from popular culture (a song, film or famous person).

The player draws a card from the category that they rolled, and chooses one line from the card. A timer is started, and the other players have to guess what is being drawn or modelled. In some cases, the player is allowed to act and move with the object they are modelling. If the team guess correctly, a miniature representing a marker pen is moved on to the next space of that colour.

Some board spaces have special features. "All Play" means all teams are allowed to guess instead of just the team whose turn it currently is (and move on the board if they guess correctly). "X" means the team moves back by one space if they do not guess correctly. And a "2" means the team has twice the amount of time to guess (the sand timer is turned twice).

To win the game, a team must complete two separate challenges (with two separate rolls of the dice) within the normal time limit, a single turn of the sand timer.

Description from the publisher:

Nightfall at Camp Havenwood is a horror/slasher themed co-op, survival game using the programming mechanic. The game plays 2-5 players with a game automated horror character. Set in 1985, in the northeastern U.S., you play a group of campers who are fighting for their survival. Several bloodthirsty horrors await you in the woods and you will need to work together to either kill the horror or discover the secrets of the camp that will allow you to survive. Welcome to camp!

A co-operative medieval crime fighting game, it is a strong story driven co-operative experience, where you take on the role of watchmen trying to find and arrest criminals. When you sit down to play, you pick a case to attempt, some are for beginners while others challenge even the most experienced players.

During your turn you must prioritise either gathering clues, following up leads or hunting out information. Working together is important, as there is limited time to find and arrest the guilty before they escape and you lose. After you’ve finished your turn, a story card is drawn. These cards change the game, moving the suspects, adding special rules and generally making the game tougher.

name.value: DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light – Collector's Box

item.description: Each DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light – Collector's Box comes with everything one player needs to play from the Starter Set: 20 custom dice, one felt dice bag, 10 Basic Action Cards, and four Indicator Cards. Each DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light – Collector's Box also comes with one Full Art Promo Card, four DC Dice Masters DC Comics foil packs, and two dice storage trays that hold over 300 dice!

link.value: DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light
DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Iron Man and War Machine Starter Set
Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell

item.description:
ColourCards (also known as ColoCards) is a game system. It consists of a deck of 100 unique coloured cards which are used to play many different games which are quick to learn and play.

The cards use five 'colours’: Red, Blue, Green, Black and White. Each card has three ‘aspects’: Word, Text and Background. The Word is the name of one of the five colours, the Text of that word is written in one of the colours, and the Background of the card is in a different colour. Three different colours may feature in a card's aspects, but if the background or text is the same colour as the word, the card will only have two colours.

There are many different games that can be played with ColourCards. These include ColourCall (spot which colour appears the most among a set of cards), ColourCount (write down how many times each colour appears among a set of cards), ColourSeek (deduce the aspects of a hidden card), ColourSet (find 2 cards with 5 colours), ColourPairs (find 2 cards with matching colours), ColourFind (a memory game of finding matching cards), ColourPerudo (a bluffing and guessing game where players challenge each other until only one remains), ColourFamilies (a cooperative game of making 'families' of 5 related cards), ColourCry (race against each other to put matches cards on top of each other to empty your hand), ColourSnap (a 2-player game of collecting your opponent's cards), ColourSpeed (quickly say the colour of the writing - based on the Stroop test).

ENTER A WORLD OF VICTORIAN HORROR!

In 19th-century Rome, ancient crypts have been discovered beneath the Capuchin tombs. Take on the role of a dauntless explorer and plunder these catacombs of their secrets and spoils. Build your catacomb as you go, seeking finds and surviving horrors. End your story before the evils of the catacomb devour you all!

IN TENEBRIS LUX is a game for 1-4 players ages 13 and up, and can be played in about 45 minutes to an hour. 
Players rush to explore and resolve personal quests, called narratives, before their opponents can resolve their own, or the dark catacombs close in on them, ending the game.

The game is played in turns, each broken into 3 Steps, with several Phases.

STEP 1: BREATHE The first Step adds Rooms to the Catacombs, by drawing them from a random pile. This builds up the game board out of playing card sized map pieces, or Rooms. This step also has a phase allowing Explorers to change their gear, referred to as Equipment or Finds… this is critical as these important items strengthen an Explorer so that they may deal with the dangers to come. Following phases allow an Explorer to adjust their card hand and play any non-room cards, if so desired.

STEP 2: SEEK The second step allows Explorers to actually explore and navigate through the Catacombs, or growing game board. This dangerous course allows Explorers to search for new Finds and gear. More phases allow for adding extra Rooms, or cards, onto the board, moving around from card to card, and interacting with Room Cards in order to complete Naratives, or the game’s objectives. This is the Phase where Explorers are most at risk of stumbling upon Horrors, as they are actively exploring the Catacombs.

STEP 3: SURVIVE In Step 3 Horrors, the game’s many monsters in the dark, may attack your Explorer! Canny and brave Explorers may also strike out and attack each other in hopes of thwarting each other’s progress in pursuit of personal Narratives. This phase resolves each combat one by one, and adjusts health and loot bodies.

Basic combat is simple. As the attacker, role one of the game’s 14 included dice, and add it to your chosen Trait (Grit, Wit or Daring). The Defender rolls one die and adds it to their same Trait, as they defend along the same lines as the incoming attack. Whichever result is highest wins.

The game’s “Combat Reference Card” will take players through any extra steps, notably the way in which rooms impact the outcomes with rolls in combat. Each Horror and Explorer features an affinity with different Room types, this gives an edge or disadvantage in combat. Be careful of the Room you land on, it will have dire consequences!

After each Step is resolved a player finishes their turn and, moving clockwise, the next player goes, and so on. The game is ended when one player completes their randomly drawn Narrative objective, all Explorers are killed, or the Doom Counter (the Game’s timer) has run its course, sending the catacombs crashing in on the hapless Explorers.

In Tenebris Lux comes with 13 Jumbo Explorer cards, 4 jumbo Combat and Turn Cycle reference cards, a full color rule book, 24 Horror cards, 18 Equipment cards, 21 Find cards, 12 Narrative cards, 32 Room cards, 3 Great Room Jumbo cards, one Jumbo Doom Counter card, 14 Dice, 13 Double Sided Explorer counters with 4 stands, and a counter for each Horror as well as many counters to help record progress for Narratives.

name.value: Ricky Dillon's Twisted Truth or Dare

item.description:
Social media influencer, Ricky Dillon creates his first ever card game in Twisted Truth Or Dare.

Written and created by Ricky, the game includes 300 unique playing cards - 150 Twisted, 75 Truth, 75 Dare.

Separate your cards into 3 decks: Twisted Cards, Truth Cards, and Dare Cards

1. The card-puller picks a Twisted Card and identifies the specific person in the group it most likely represents.

2. Once that most likely person is selected, he/she pulls a Truth or Dare Card and completes the card.

3. Once the most likely person completes the Truth or Dare, they pick a new Twisted Card and the round starts over.

4. The person to have 10 Twisted Cards loses. Whoever has the fewest Twisted Cards wins.

One month ago, Star-ship union find an asteroid with many historical remains near the SiTan galaxy. One after another, treasure-hunters arrive this ruin star and search the treasure by the loading of symbols on remains' wall.
Now, it's time for you to show up. Players take a role of treasure-hunters. following the guide of map and racing to the finish first.
In the Ruinstar, draft randomly map-cards forming the race track, namely the map in current game. Also, players will take their own meeples and put them on the origin of map. During the game, players draft cards on the center and play them from hands on the front of themselves, acting as a their own exploration-cards colunm. Then, that player can get some symbols on the cards played by him and may use these symbols for other actions,such as destroy others' exploration-cards column or extra advance his/her meeple.
It's the most important and interesting that how to prevent others' plan and use your own symbols for advance on the map with Combos.

My Mighty Crystals is a colorful family board game, with lovely 3D miniatures characters. It's a race for 2-4 players along a path on which you will collect mighty crystals and meet funny creatures that you can control with your crystals. Each player can collect a maximum of three crystals, and more crystals are offered at the end of the race depending on the order of arrival. The player who owns the most crystals wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Populations is an insanely addictive game about primitive fantasy races and their struggles to sort out who's land is who's!

Throughout the game, players will explore a vast and mysterious world in order to find useful resources and victory points. The various resources (i.e. stone, wood, textile) are used to grow population, build fantastic castles, and discover useful technologies.

Specifically, on a players turn, they may spend action points to increase and move their population around the map, and to build castles to secure lands. Additionally, players may always explore new lands by drawing new land tiles and adding them to the known world!

Depending on the number of players, a victory point goal is set at the beginning of the game. Once a player has achieved the preset goal on their turn, they win the game. Likewise, if a player eliminates all other players from the game, then they stand victorious!
4 player race game flying around a map of the world. The objective is to fly your plane between connected cities on a map of the world being first to the final stop.

This takes the elements of a JRPG and puts them into an epic co-op tabletop adventure game. Players explore on a mini-map, grinding away as they search for the set-piece encounters - large battles that make or break the players.

The game is set up in Acts, with each act being represented as a box of map tiles and encounters. Each act is meant to be played in a single sitting (1.5-2 hours), and then strung together into an epic 3-act story, concluding with a massive boss fight. That boss is defined by the earlier 3-acts and since the game features lots of different acts, there is lots of replay value.

During the game, players use a bag of tokens that represents their characters "stats." When players use various abilities, instead of rolling dice to check for success, they will draw tokens from their bag and check the various icons and runes to see if they succeed. As players level-up, they will swap in ever-more-impressive tokens.

These token bags are also used by the heroes' enemies. Get set on fire? Put a fire token in your bag and you'll be on-fire until you draw it out. Get poisoned? Put 3 Poison tokens into your bag taking damage each time one comes out until you find a heal poison potion, etc...

To win the game, players must battle through 3 acts and then a mega boss.

Soldier Ball is a tabletop skill and strategy game that can be learned in 60 seconds and enjoyed for hours.

How to Play:

Two dice are rolled to determine the number of soldiers and barricades for the game. Players are then allowed 2 minutes to arrange their home base as they choose using the determined number of soldiers and barricades. Players then take turns rolling the battle ball into the opposing army in an attempt to knock soldiers down. When a soldier is knocked down, it is removed from play. The player with the last soldier standing wins the game.

Description from the designer:

The year is 1492. It is Sunday. The old pope is dead and now the race is on for the election of the new pope. You’re one of the hopefuls in this election, however, not everyone is on your side… yet. But don’t worry, they’ll come around once you show them a little financial appreciation. After all, everyone has a vote, and everyone can be bought. And once the new pope is elected, the richest player wins—just like in real life.

The goal in Habeamus is to amass more money than the other players, while electing a new pope. Every player has one vote, and there are three non-player cardinals with a vote each as well. During their turns, players can place bribes face-down on the non-player cardinals in the middle of the playing field. These cardinals will vote for whomever promises the largest bribe when the vote starts.
Each player also has a vote that they can use for themselves, or sell to other players. Every player can make hidden or open bribe offers to other players. If, during the vote count, a player accepts an offer by another player, that bribe goes into their account. However, if they do not accept the offer, the player making the offer gets the bribe into their account. In this way, players will have to balance their offers to other players and make sure they themselves sell their vote for a good price. To shake things up a bit more, a player can increase the papal salary, or play actions to change the bribes already on offer.
Once all cards have been played, the votes are counted. If a pope is elected, he will receive a salary bonus into their account. Then, every player counts their money and the richest player wins.

A snowbound small village. It quietly approaches and sneaks into the innermost part of a villager's heart. When the night has come and everyone else is sleeping, it quietly wakes up. The brutal murderer wanders around the village and preys on honest villagers. Who is the heinous monster?

Rocca Monster is a hidden role/social deduction game for 3-6 players. Each player is dealt three villagers which are placed on the table in front of them. One of the villagers in the game is secretly the monster. All players close there eyes and count to ten, during which time the player with the monster card places a six sided die on a villager of their choice. After the count is finished all players open their eyes and see who was attacked in the night. That player rolls the die, and on a roll of 1-4 the villager on whom the die was placed is killed. On a roll of 5 or 6 the villager survives the attack. After the murder (or attempted murder) the players discuss who they think the monster is, and then use their voting cards to vote for which villager they want to accuse of being the monster. Once a single villager has the majority of votes their card is turned over and it is revealed whether they were the monster or not. If they were the monster then the other players win! If they were not the monster then their card is removed from the game and play continues. Another night attack occurs, followed by another round of discussion and voting. This cycle continues until either the monster successfully kills half the villagers (at which point the monster player wins the game), or until the players successfully identify the monster (at which point the monster player loses and everyone else wins).

Frog Family Fun-Pack is an educational game for children, with various math and reading modules, all using the same rules and board. Players take turns choosing a card and attempting to answer the question on the card. If the answer is correct, they move their pawn on a track the number or spaces printed on the back of the card. If the answer is wrong, the card is placed back in the middle of the stack. Extra turn spaces and shortcuts also appear on the track. The first player to reach the end wins.

"Big Hero 6" is a 6 in 1 Action game.

The game has 32 cards which are used in each of the six games.

The games are based on classics children cards games as follows;


 Action Game - Win by getting ride of your cards as soon as possible.
 Action Game Snap - Win by getting all the cards.
 Pairs Game - Win by collectiong the most pairs.
 Double Pars Game - Win by collection the most double pairs.
 Donkey Game - Win by not having the "Donkey" card in your hand at the end of the game.
 Happy Families Game - Collect the most Happy Families.


First published as part of a collection of promotional card games for Morrisons Supermarkets in the UK.

Contents;
32 Playing cards.
2 Rules cards

5ive: King's Court is a set-building game in which players take turns attempting to foil the plans of their rivals by completing their own royal court.

Players compete to complete a set of all five card types by completing each of five actions. Every action impacts another player, so strategy is critical. Simple errors in judgement could prevent you from completing your court, allowing another player to take control and win the game!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Balance game by Lidl, a wooden dexterity game were you stack wooden cilinders on a tilting turtle.

A big wooden turtle lays on its back forming an unstable half moon shaped base the feet kerp the cilinders from rolling of. You roll one die or both dice and add a cilinder of the rolled color on the turtle. If the cilinders drop you lose. A bit like animal upon animal but without cute animals and a rocking base.

The main point of this game is to level up fast through game experience. In this fantasy-themed game, your Hero can go up 21 levels in a single game session!

Players customize the powers of their heroes though rapid leveling up — with every passing round, their heroes gain experience and grow in power.

Heroes use abilities, tons of items, skills, and spells against enemy units in order to defend the Realm and find the Ancient Artifact before it's too late!

Each player will develop their own Hero during the game. .


 There are also extra cards for a Players VS Player version of the game.


During the game:
Players may recruit new characters, take control of mines (which produce gold and resources for the Cities), and most importantly, defeat the enemy units which occupy the map and Dungeon.

Game-play:
On your turn, your Hero (Attack) rolls one dice (or more in higher Level) AND additional black dice for each enemy in your Location. If the number of your Hero rolled dice matches the number of a Item, Skill, Spell Card that your Hero owns, he gets the effect of that Card.
If the number of enemy rolled dice (black) matches the number on enemy Card, it deals damage to your Hero and gets the effect of own Card.

At the most of the time your Hero rolled die will trigger other Players Cards. Yes, a lot of cards may be activated by other Players rolls and the owner of the Card gains the effect.
After combat roll, your Hero may spend Experience points to get new Skill and Spell Cards, and spending gold for new Items (weapons, armors, items, scrolls).

END OF THE GAME
Lose: lost one of the main City OR lost all magic towers/mines OR then Dungeon population reached the max.
Win: find the ancient artifact in the Dungeon AND clear the main 3 Cities from the enemies.

Contains

Dice (36x): 

 d4 x15,
 d6 x10,
 d8 x5,
 d10 x3,
 d12 x2,
 d20




Cards (486x)

 Different Hero Cards: 16x
 Different Item cards: 82x + enemy Units rewards 148x
 Different Skill Cards: 156x
 Different Spell Cards: 74x
 Different Attachments Cards: 32x
 Different Enemy Units Cards: 114x 
 Different Locations Cards: 54x
 Different Event Cards: 46x




Large spell books Cards: 20x

The march of humankind’s progress has threatened the survival of many species. It's up to you and the team to save them! Work with your fellow conservationists to save a species (tigers, sea otters) from extinction. Influence the UN Ambassadors to pass a resolution protecting the animals and stopping environmental destruction. If four UN ambassadors vote yes on the resolution then the players win, but until the vote takes place, players need to keep the destruction at bay, and keep the animals alive!

Each turn players will roll the dice they can allocate to action cards. However, the die placed to take an action must be larger than one previously placed or the card is locked to that player. After actions are taken, mating pairs will have a chance to procreate, and destruction tiles will enter the board, possibly killing already scarce animals. Then the active player chooses who will go next.

Play as the Zoologist, Philanthropist, TV Wildlife Host, Lobbyist, or Environmental Lawyer, each with a special ability that affects game play.

Time is short. Can the animals be saved while also influencing the Ambassadors' votes? Or will threatened animals be lost forever?

item.description:
Peril and plunder await your pirate crew in Firelock’s newest game, Scurvy Dice! In this highly competitive dice roller you will strive against other commanders in a ship of your own design to pillage
the wealth of the East Indies and the other captains with whom you compete. Broadsides and boarding actions are just some of the exciting encounters you will face in your race to riches. You will need boldness, cunning and not a small amount of luck to best your opponents and conquer life at sea. Will fortune favor you? Find out, in Scurvy Dice!

Scurvy Dice is played over a series of rounds called treasure hunts. Players will roll their ship dice to build and refit their ships to battle their opponents and race to find the best treasure at parrot island - all while trying to avoid getting scurvy.

—description from the publisher

Prepare to fire the Shakespearean Canon!

Presenting Munchkin Shakespeare, a Shakespeare-themed version of the popular Munchkin card game! Players have requested a Shakespearean version for years, and some of you even helped us brainstorm these puns...

A storm has blown through the sleepy, fairy-tail hamlet of Ewetopia, releasing the sheep from their barns and now they’ve all congregated into a massive, mixed-up herd in the middle of the valley! Players step into the role of village farmers, who must use their feisty canine companions to help them herd back the lost flocks.

Ewetopia is charming, fast-paced, easily-to-learn, and hard-to-master. With warm, friendly graphics that have appeal for kids, it will also appeal to older audiences with it’s deceptively tactical game play: A strong denial game, board control, and a playing field that can change with every turn means Ewetopia enjoy plenty of play-time with old and young alike.

Players command their trusty dog around a 5x5 grid filled with tiles containing numerically ranked sheep, pushing rows and columns of them, adding the tiles that get pushed off the grid to their collection. The dogs are very fast and will always move at least 2 squares during their turn, so although they can be made to change direction after their 1st move, they can’t then move back into the square they just came from: Players will need to plan their turn to avoid collecting the wrong tiles or ending up out-of-position.

Opponents’ dogs can’t be pushed and will create obstacles on the board, but if this happens, or if a player wants to create a better move for themselves, fences can be built in the way of the charging sheep, diverting their path in a direction of the player's choice. Since these fences remain in the ground until the end of the game --and act the same for every player-- the result is a maze-like meadow where creative, zigzag moves aren’t just possible, but become the norm.

Adding to the brain-twisting mix are special tiles, including:
Motivating Bones: When collected, can be consumed at any time to “motivate” a dog to move an extra square. Useful to push your dog to get a rare sheep, or to force an opponent to make tough choice if their dog is in a bad position.
Wild Sheep: A mythical breed with technicolor wool, these sheep can count as any rank at the end of the game, making them especially versatile.
Wolves: A snarky, stenchy wolf-pack have sneakily donned sheep costumes in order to blend into the herd. Their own rank, having them at the end of the game will reduce your score by stinking up your other sheep’s wool.
Wood Carts: Contains enough lumber to build an additional fence on the board when traded in, and may be used immediately after being collected.

At the end of the game, points are awarded based on sizes of unbroken, numerical sequences AND sets of same-ranked sheep, allowing players to pursue different paths to victory if their original plans are foiled. Point values scale logarithmically with size, meaning a single big set or sequence will always be better than several smaller ones. After separating their sheep into the largest sets and/or sequences possible, totaling their values --and subtracting points for wolves-- the player with the highest score is the victor!

item.description:
Jeu de rébus is a French game. Images are shown on a board and you must match them to create as much rebus as you can before the time runs out. A rebus containing 2 syllables counts for 2 points, 3 or more syllables counts for 5 points.

While the game only provides 5 tokens for five players, you may play as much as you want as long as you provide additional tokens. Great party game for everyone!

Official description from Ludik Québec :

20 images sont placées sur une planche de jeu et le sablier est retourné.

Tu dois inscrire le plus de mots possible en te servant des sons représentés par les images retournées.

Plus tu utilises d’images, plus les points marqués seront nombreux.

Idyllon was the crown jewel of Faerie Queen Nivarra’s kingdom... once upon a time. But after a great betrayal at the hands of Ancient Therha, this once great land has dissolved into formless void. While all of those who remember its beauty mourn this tremendous loss, you – the Guardians of the Four Winds – have vowed to restore Idyllon to its former glory.

Groves is a strategy game that combines worker placement with bag building. There are multiple worker types that a guardian can summon to reap the benefits of the land. Using any worker-type will gain you a land’s ability but using a worker that is elementally linked to that land type will also earn you an additional ability to edge you closer to gaining the crown. 
Playing in other players’ groves may also work to your advantage; however, although you will be able to gain the ability of the land, your sprits will end up in your opponents’ summoning bag. Can you build your grove and manage your pool of spirits to become the new Ruler of Idyllon?

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

WHAT IS IT?

Santimanitay: Race to the Stage, is an action-packed board game based around Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. Two to eight players compete to reach their ultimate goal - The Stage. The path to their ultimate goal is filled with challenges; players must avoid Hard Luck spaces, get past Midnight Robbers, take advantage of Warrahoon cards AND display their knowledge of Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. As unpredictable as it is enjoyable, Santimanitay is a must have for anyone interested in Carnival, board games or just having fun.

WHO’S IT FOR?

Santimanitay was conceptualized as a game that captures the spirit and fun of Trinidad and Tobago while preserving important aspects of our history and culture. The game is designed for 2 to 8 players, making it suitable for any situation or occasion, from a quite evening at home to the highlight of a Friday night lime. The ability to choose characters with different attributes can give an advantage to those who may not be as familiar with Trinidad and Tobago’s culture and history, making Santimanitay universally enjoyable. From age 8 to 80, choose a character and start the race!

WHY DO IT?

Known as the greatest show on earth, Trinidad and Tobago Carnival is a festival of beauty, colour, and pageantry. All aspects of Carnival have a rich and storied history; music, costuming, performance. As well-known as the festival may be, not many people know in what year the first Panorama was held, or who was the first winner of the International Soca Monarch competition, or even when the Canboulay Riots occurred in Port of Spain. Santimanitay was developed to help share and preserve this knowledge through engaging game play, memorable characters and challenging questions.

Chemistry Fluxx is the elemental card game in which the rules are always changing. Use atoms and laboratory gear to match the current goal and win!

Chemistry Fluxx is the perfect compound of chance and skill in which you'll not only be playing with elements and molecules, but you'll also be learning about them!

Are you a risk taker? How well do you trust your memory? Do you believe in luck?

In the card game BOLD, you're trying to match cards that show three kinds of containers that vary in color, size, and pattern. Can you remember where the matches are? And will you be willing to put your points where your memory is? Shuffle the cards, then place them face down in a grid formation. The first player reveals two cards. Do the containers match in type, color, size, or pattern? If yes, that's a pair! Now comes a test of your mettle: Will you take your points and run, or will you gamble them by flipping another card and hoping it shares a feature with the first two? The game becomes more intense as it goes on and you remember more!

Snappy Dressers cards show quirky and delightful animal characters dressed in the snappiest of outfits! Cards are beautifully designed with interesting animals like the sloth, panda, and fox — all dressed in funky, cool outfits. Players try to identify a match, such as types of animal, items of clothing, or the gifts in the characters' hands. Each card matches every other card in exactly one way!

Snappy Dressers includes ten different games to play with one deck of cards, ranging from speed recognition to sly strategy.

name.value: Charlock Holmes: Sur La Piste De Fourriarty

item.description:
Furriarty is terrorizing London, and it's up to Purrrlock Holmes to stop him before he completes his plans and escapes! However, Purrrlock cannot do it alone and you, as a newly inducted Inspector at Scotland Pound, must help bust members of Furriarty's gang in order to help Purrrlock get closer to the bewhiskered baddie that's been bullying all of Baker Street.

In more detail, each player in Purrrlock Holmes: Furriarty's Trail draws a hidden suspect card. Players take turns making guesses using a "clock" mechanism about their unknown suspect’s identity. The other players (who can see every suspect but their own) will tell you whether you've got a lead on your suspect; if not, it's a dead-end. Figure out enough leads to deduce the suspect's identity, and you get to snag a clue that leads to Furriarty. Each clue is labeled with a variable number of victory points. Every round, Furriarty pads his way closer to escape, putting tension on the players to guess — quickly! — to solve the case. If you can deduce enough suspects and collect enough paw print tokens, you may be able to overtake Furriarty before he scrams.

Get ready, Inspector, as the game is officially afoot — or a-paw, if you will...

Components:

 60 Clue cards
 5 Player boards
 5 Card stands
 18 Paw Print tokens
 2 Furriarty/Award tokens
 1 Rulebook

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sedis is a “generic gaming device”. Much like dominoes or playing cards, Sedis can be used to play and create many different games.

Each Sedis set consists of 60 hexagonal tiles, which can be evenly divided among one to six players. The arrangement of pips and blanks are conducive to patterns and interpretations that can be used to guide each game. These two attributes – the congruent shape of the tiles and the dot patterns unique to each tile – open up a world of board configurations, mechanisms, and ways to play.

Sedis has many different game mechanics which form the backbone of games, including:

Aligning tiles and matching pips/blanks
Rotating tiles
Stacking tiles
“Battle’ mechanics
Trading
Betting/Gambling
Bluffing
Partnering/Communicating
Collaborating
Interpreting pips as numbers
Interpreting pips as Morse code
And more mechanics continued to be discovered

Wild In The Streets is a fast paced miniatures game of straight-edgers, crust punks, goths and more fighting in the streets. With skirmish level, low miniature count gangs and easy to learn rules brutal street brawls can be played in an hour. Unique scenarios like Record Store Day let the gangs fight it out to get the other guys' precious vinyl. Or it could be a simple turf war with punks fighting over control of the local half-pipe. Card-driven alternating activation keeps the combats fresh and cuts out the down time. This game is fast and bloody. With a bottle in one hand and a axe in the other unleash your inner brawler with Wild In The Streets.

True Story is an adult party game where you use cards prompts to inspire stories of extraordinary experiences or legendary lies. One player draw a card, tells a story involving the prompt on the card, and the other players guess whether or not the story is true or false. If the majority of players guess incorrectly the storyteller keeps the card. Play continues until one player has three cards.

Maniacal, formerly known as Infamous, is a strategy game in which 2-5 aspiring supervillains compete to become the most (in)famous in the world. Choose from one of five villains, each with unique abilities and weaknesses. First, build a secret base by drafting from over seventy different rooms, such as a Robotics Lab, Massage Parlor, or Torture Chamber. These rooms will attract a motley assortment of henchmen to your lair: Beasts, Criminals, Scientists, and Mystics. Want more brainy Scientists around? Build rooms that appeal to them (a Planetarium? or perhaps an Intrinsic Field Chamber?). In this way, each player will construct a unique secret base and recruit a unique crew of henchmen.

Then, assign your henchmen to evil contracts posted around the globe. Become a local warlord in Asia. Steal a nuclear warhead in Europe. Build a floating fortress of doom in South America! Time, however, is a critical resource. The farther away a contract is from your secret base, the more weeks you spend and the fewer contracts that you'll complete in a round. Succeed at contracts to earn infamy and money. Fail, and your henchman might get injured, captured, or serendipitously gain a superpower.

Build your secret base, recruit henchmen, and complete as many missions as you can. Along the way, hire mercenaries, hatch schemes, and chastise your lackey. Do so, and the history books might remember you as the best of the worst!

item.description:
Dazzling gems are the focus of your quest in Sapphiro. Play your diamond tiles to capture rubies, emeralds, and other valuable jewels by matching colors and surrounding the gems. Be careful not to leave a quick or easy way for your opponents to do the same. Be the first to collect one jewel of each color to win.

Includes wooden game board, 100 wooden tiles, 30 gems and rules.

In Time Breaker, you work for the security division of the Time Repair Agency. A Time Breaker has gotten loose, and you must apprehend them before they do any serious damage to the space-time continuum. Soon they will begin closing down the time doorways we need to use to pursue them. The agent who brings in this perp will get a promotion, and thus win. Quick everybody, into the time machine!

item.description:
Fantasy Fantasy Football is an inventive card game in which you are the Oracle manager of a football team of powerful and gruesome fantasy creatures battling through a season of fantasy football. Go head-to-head against other Oracle managers and battle the elements, manage bye weeks, and use your team's magic powers wisely.

Developed by designers Daryl Andrews and J.R. Honeycutt with art by Rob Lundy, Fantasy Fantasy Football is a roster-building card game in which players must assemble and manage a team through a season full of unexpected challenges using players skills and magical abilities to win games.

link.value: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

name.value: My First Memory: What Animals Eat

item.description:
My First Memory: What Animals Eat is a tile matching game featuring various animals and the foods they eat. Younger children can play it as a simple matching game, finding pairs of identical tiles, while older children might enjoy slightly more difficulty by matching animals to the foods they eat.

Players begin by placing the tiles in rows, picture side down. The first player takes his turn by flipping over two tiles. If they are a match, he keeps the tiles and takes another turn. If the tiles do not match, the player returns them to their face down positions, and the next player takes her turn. Play continues until all of the tiles have been matched and collected. The player with the most tiles wins.

In this 2-player game, players use the cards in their hand to manipulate a function that allows players to trade in their colored cubes for more/different colored cubes in order to complete the goals set out at the beginning of the game. Once a player completes 2 of the 3 goals available, they win!

War has a price and it's time to pay!
War Cash is a quick casual war game where players use Cash Cards to fund battle actions for fighting your opponents or to help you survive.

A 2 - 4 player game where all 12 Cash Cards are shuffled and players draw one Cash Card and bank or fully pay an action.

Any player can fully pay an action and use it - so the player needs to think - should they pay?

Matches is the hottest new card game!
When you play with fire, you're going to get burned!

Matches is a card game for 3-4 players. Players will take turns "Matching" the number that was first played each round. Everyone has 2 ways to score points: Either outlasting everyone and taking the fire tokens from the Match card, OR by burning out early and scoring the pairs that they alone have played.

This is very easy to pick up, and there are 12 additional cards called Burn cards to change the game to a more strategic and manipulative experience.

Recreate the action and drama of 17th century warfare on your tabletop with The Pikeman's Lament. Start by creating your officer; is he a natural leader raised from the ranks, the youngest son of a noble family, or an old veteran who has seen too many battles?

As you campaign, your officer will win honor and gain promotion, acquiring traits that may help lead his men to victory. Before each skirmish, your officer must raise his company from a wide range of unit options: Should he lean towards hard-hitting heavy cavalry or favor solid, defensively minded infantry? Companies are typically formed from 6-8 units, each made up of either 6 or 12 figures, and quick, decisive, and dramatic games are the order of the day. With core mechanisms based on Daniel Mersey's popular Lion Rampant rules, The Pikeman's Lament captures the military flavor of the 17th century, and allows you to recreate skirmishes and raids from conflicts such as the Thirty Years' War, the English Civil Wars, and the Great Northern War.

In this pirate game you have to find the chest which is hiding Jack Pott's treasure and after getting it be the first to make it to the canoe to win the game. For playing the game you need a free app that guided you through the whole game.

When it's your turn you roll the dice within the app and walk with your pirate figure the eyes number on a symbol on the game board. Depending on what figure your move ends you interact with the app which tells you what happens next or what you have to do. The game board shows a pirate ship which is devided in different parts. In each part is a treasure chest which maybe hides the treasure of Jack Pott.

The app uses augmented reality to scan the game board and it shows animations of the different characters which guided through the game
